<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	L&#226;le White
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	has served on our Board since March&nbsp;2015.&#160; Ms.&nbsp;White is the chief executive officer of XIFIN,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;XIFIN&#148;), a financial cloud computing company, with over 25 years of experience in information systems development and medical billing.&#160; She lectures extensively on these topics and has consulted for major laboratories and laboratory associations throughout the U.S. Ms.&nbsp;White worked with HCFA and the U.S. Office of the Inspector General to develop the first OIG Model Compliance Program. She is a member of the board of directors of bioTheranostics, part of the worldwide bioMerieux group, and is a longstanding member of the California Clinical Lab Association, where for the last eight years she has chaired the state and federal contractor committees that work with the Medicare Administrative Contractors and the Department of Health and Human Services.&#160; Ms.&nbsp;White was previously vice president - finance of Laboratory Corporation of America, one of the largest clinical reference laboratories in the U.S., and its predecessor National Health Laboratories, where she led the software development of several accounts receivable, inventory, cost accounting and financial management systems for the laboratory industry.&#160; Ms.&nbsp;White has a BA in finance and an MBA from Florida International University. We believe Ms.&nbsp;White&#146;s qualifications to serve on our Board include her significant executive experience with the strategic, financial, and operational requirements of health care organizations, particularly in the area of billing and reimbursement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Directors and officers are elected on an annual basis. The term of each director&#146;s service expires at our next annual meeting of stockholders and at such time as his or her successor is duly elected and qualified. Officers serve at the discretion of the Board.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	There are no family relationships between any of our directors or executive officers and any other of our directors or executive officers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Board of Directors
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our Bylaws provide that the size of our Board is to be determined from time to time by resolution of the Board but shall consist of at least five and no more than nine members. Our Board has fixed the exact number of directors at seven.
</FONT>
	Our Board currently consists of six members, four of whom &#151; Dr.&nbsp;Gottlieb, Ms.&nbsp;White and Messrs.&nbsp;Hoffman and Jones &#151; our Board has determined to be independent under the rules&nbsp;of the NASDAQ Stock Market.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Jessup will be considered independent under the rules&nbsp;of the NASDAQ Stock Market beginning March&nbsp;15, 2015.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Jessup serves as Chairman of the Board, and we believe that separation of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer roles supports the independent nature of our Board. At each annual meeting of stockholders, members of our Board are elected to serve until the next annual meeting and until their successors are duly elected and qualified. There is currently one vacancy on our Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We are subject to a number of technological, regulatory, product, legal and other types of risks. The Board and its constituent committees are responsible for overseeing these risks, and we employ a number of procedures to help them carry out that duty. For example, Board members regularly consult with executive management about pending issues and expected challenges, and at each Board meeting directors receive updates from, and have an opportunity to interview and ask questions of, key personnel and management. Furthermore, because our Chief Executive Officer serves as a member of our Board, we believe that the Board has a direct channel and better access to insights into our performance, business and challenges
</FONT>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Committees of the Board of Directors
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Board has established an Audit Committee, a Compensation Committee, and a Nominating and Governance Committee.&#160; Each committee operates pursuant to a charter that may be viewed on our website at
<I>
	www.combimatrix.com
</I>
	. The inclusion of our website address in this report does not include or incorporate by reference the information on our website into this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Audit Committee.
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
	Our Audit Committee oversees our accounting and financial reporting processes and is responsible for (i)&nbsp;retaining, evaluating and, if appropriate, recommending the termination of our independent registered public accounting firm, (ii)&nbsp;approving the services performed by our independent registered public accounting firm and (iii)&nbsp;for reviewing and evaluating our accounting principles, financial reporting practices, and system of internal accounting controls. The Audit Committee is also responsible for maintaining communication between the Board and our independent registered public accounting firm, and has established procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters, and for the confidential, anonymous submission by our employees of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters. In addition, all related person transactions are reviewed and approved by the Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015, our Audit Committee consisted of Messrs.&nbsp;Hoffman (the committee&#146;s Chairman) Jones and Dr.&nbsp;Gottlieb until May&nbsp;2015 and, thereafter, consisted of Messrs.&nbsp;Hoffman (the committee&#146;s Chairman) and Jones and Ms.&nbsp;White, representing the current members of our Audit Committee. The Board has determined that all members of our Audit Committee are independent under the listing standards of the NASDAQ Stock Market and the rules&nbsp;of the Securities and Exchange Commission, and that Mr.&nbsp;Hoffman qualifies as an &#147;audit committee financial expert,&#148; as defined by the rules&nbsp;of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	35
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_35_114637_5335">

<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Compensation Committee
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<I>
	.
</I>
	&nbsp;Our Compensation Committee assists our Board in determining the compensation of our executive officers and directors. The Compensation Committee is responsible for approving the compensation package of each executive officer and recommending each executive officer&#146;s compensation to the Board. The Compensation Committee also administers our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended. The Compensation Committee may form and delegate any of its responsibilities to subcommittees when appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015 and through the date of this filing, our Compensation Committee consists of Messrs.&nbsp;Jones (the committee&#146;s Chairman) and Hoffman and Dr.&nbsp;Gottlieb. The Board has determined that all members of our Compensation Committee are independent under the listing standards of the NASDAQ Stock Market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Nominating and Governance Committee
</FONT>
</I>
	.
</B>
	Our Nominating and Governance Committee assists our Board by identifying and recommending individuals qualified to become members of our Board (subject to legal rights, if any, of third parties to nominate or appoint directors), and establishing, evaluating and overseeing our corporate governance processes and guidelines.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2015 and through the date of this filing, our Nominating and Governance Committee consists of Dr.&nbsp;Gottlieb (the committee&#146;s Chairman) and Mr.&nbsp;Hoffman. The Board has determined that all members of our Nominating and Governance Committee are independent under the listing standards of the NASDAQ Stock Market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Nominating and Governance Committee will consider candidates recommended by stockholders. To recommend director candidates, stockholders should submit their suggestions in writing to the Corporate Secretary, providing the proposed nominee&#146;s name, biographical data and other information about the proposed nominee and the nominating stockholder(s)&nbsp;as required by our Bylaws, together with a consent from the proposed nominee to serve on the Board if nominated and elected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	There are no specific minimum qualifications that the Nominating and Governance Committee requires to be met by a director nominee recommended for a position on the Board, nor are there any specific qualities or skills that are necessary for one or more members of our Board to possess, other than as are necessary to meet the requirements of the rules&nbsp;and regulations applicable to us. The Nominating and Governance Committee considers a potential candidate&#146;s experience, areas of expertise, and other factors relative to the overall composition of the Board, including the following characteristics:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 40.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	broad experience in business, finance or administration;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 40.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the independence requirements imposed by the Securities and Exchange Commission and the NASDAQ Stock Market; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 40.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	a background that provides a portfolio of experience and knowledge relevant to our industry.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Nominating and Governance Committee has the following policy with regard to the consideration of any director candidates recommended by security holders for the 2016 annual meeting of stockholders (subject to legal rights, if any, of third parties to nominate or appoint directors):
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 40.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	A stockholder wishing to nominate a candidate for election to the Board at the next annual meeting is required to give written notice addressed to CombiMatrix Corporation, 310 Goddard, Suite&nbsp;150,&nbsp;Irvine, CA 92618, Attn: Corporate Secretary, of his or her intention to make such a nomination. The notice of nomination must be received by the Corporate Secretary at this address within the timeframe required by our Bylaws, in order to be considered for nomination at the next annual meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 40.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The notice of nomination should include information regarding the recommended candidate relevant to a determination of whether the recommended candidate would be barred from being considered independent under NASDAQ Stock Market&#146;s Listing Qualifications or, alternatively, a statement that the recommended candidate would not be so barred. The notice of nomination also must include the nominee&#146;s name, age, business address, residence address, principal occupation or employment, and any other information required by Section&nbsp;2.10 of our Bylaws or by applicable laws or regulations. A nomination that does not comply with these requirements will not be considered.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Nominating and Governance Committee also considers director candidates that are suggested by its members, the Board or management. The Nominating and Governance Committee may, in the future, retain a third-party executive search firm to identify candidates on terms and conditions acceptable to the Nominating and Governance Committee, in its sole discretion. The process used by the Nominating and Governance Committee for identifying and evaluating nominees for director, including nominees recommended by stockholders, involves (with or without the assistance of a retained search firm) compiling names of potentially eligible candidates, conducting background and reference checks, conducting interviews with the candidate and others (as schedules permit), meeting to consider and approve the final candidates and, as appropriate, preparing and presenting to the full Board an analysis with regard to particular recommended candidates. The Nominating and Governance Committee endeavors to identify director nominees who have the highest personal and professional integrity, have demonstrated exceptional ability and judgment, and, together with other director nominees and members, are expected to serve the long-term interest of our stockholders and contribute to our overall corporate goals. Candidates proposed by stockholders will be evaluated by the Nominating and Governance Committee using the same criteria as for all other candidates. The Nominating and Governance Committee does not have a formal policy with respect to diversity; however, the Board and the Nominating and Governance Committee believe that it is essential that the Board members represent diverse viewpoints.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	36
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_36_114724_5796">
</A>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Codes of Business Conduct and Ethics
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have adopted a corporate Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, which may be viewed on our website at www.combimatrix.com.&#160; The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applies to all our officers, directors and employees, including our principal executive officer, principal financial and accounting officer and controller, or persons performing similar functions.&#160; If we effect an amendment to, or waiver from, a provision of our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we intend to satisfy our disclosure requirements by posting a description of such amendment or waiver on the website above or via a current report on Form&nbsp;8-K. The inclusion of our web site address in this report does not include or incorporate by reference the information on our web site into this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stockholder Communications with Directors
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Stockholders wishing to communicate with the Board or with a particular member or committee of the Board should address communications to the Board, or to an individual member or committee as follows:&#160; c/o CombiMatrix Corporation, Attention:&#160; Corporate Secretary, 310 Goddard, Suite&nbsp;150,&nbsp;Irvine, California 92618.&#160; All communications will be relayed to that addressee.&#160; From time to time, the Board may change the process through which stockholders communicate with the Board or its members or committees. There were no changes in this process in 2015.&#160; Please refer to our website at www.combimatrix.com for any future changes in this process.&#160; The Board or the particular director or committee of the Board to which a communication is addressed will, if it deems appropriate, promptly refer the matter either to management or to the full Board depending on the nature of the communication. The inclusion of our web site address in this report does not include or incorporate by reference the information on our web site into this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), requires our directors, officers, and persons that own more than 10 percent of a registered class of our equity securities to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the SEC. Officers, directors and greater than 10 percent stockholders are required by SEC regulations to furnish us with copies of all Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;forms they file.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Based solely upon our review of the copies of such forms received by us during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we believe that each person who, at any time during such year, was a director, officer, or beneficial owner of more than 10% of our common stock met the filing requirements during such year.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_COMPENSATION>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPENSATION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 11.&#160; EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_ITEM11_EXECUTIVECOMPENSATION_124112">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Director Compensation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Directors who are also our employees receive no separate compensation from us for their service as members of the Board. Prior to June&nbsp;17, 2015, non-employee directors automatically received a non-discretionary initial grant of options to purchase 2,000 shares of our common stock upon joining the Board. On the first business day of each calendar year, each non-employee Board member then in office was automatically granted additional options to purchase 2,000 shares of our common stock, provided such individual had served as a non-employee Board member for at least six (6)&nbsp;months. All such grants were granted at an exercise price equal to the closing market price on the date of grant. Options granted since 2012 vest in four equal annual installments over a 48 month period measured from the grant date.&#160; On June&nbsp;17, 2015, our stockholders approved certain changes to our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, including the removal of the auto-grant feature for non-employee directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In January&nbsp;2015, each of our non-employee directors received a discretionary award of restricted stock units (RSUs) for 835 shares of our common stock.&#160; 25% of the shares of common stock subject to the RSUs vest on each anniversary of the grant date over a four year period.&#160; The RSUs may vest on an accelerated basis in accordance with the terms of our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan and, in the event of death or a permanent disability, the vesting of the RSUs will accelerate by twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Prior to January&nbsp;26, 2016, non-employee directors received compensation in the amount of $1,500 per month for their service as members of the Board.&#160; The Chairman of the Board received compensation in the amount of $2,000 per month for service as Chairman of the Board.&#160; During 2015, non-employee directors received $1,000 for each meeting of the Board attended in person, $1,000 for each meeting attended by telephone that was longer than one hour in length, and $500 for each meeting attended by telephone if the meeting was one hour or less in length.&#160; On January&nbsp;26, 2016, our Board and Compensation Committee approved a modification to director compensation such that per-meeting fees were eliminated, the Chairman of the Board is to receive $30,000 per year for his services to the Company, and all other non-employee directors are to receive $24,000 per year for their services to the Company.&#160; These fees will be paid quarterly.&#160; Also, Directors are reimbursed for expenses incurred in connection with attendance at meetings of the Board and committees of the Board and in connection with the performance of Board duties
</FONT>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	37
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_37_114803_2897">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Amounts shown do not reflect cash compensation actually received by the non-employee directors.&#160; Instead, the amounts shown are the non-cash aggregate grant date fair values of stock option and RSU awards made during the periods presented as determined pursuant to ASC Topic 718 and excludes the effect of forfeiture assumptions.&#160; Also, these awards generally vest over a four-year period from the date of grant.&#160; The assumptions used to calculate the fair value of stock option and RSU awards are set forth under Note 2 to the Consolidated Financial Statements included elsewhere in this report.

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="1" WIDTH="25%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:BLACK;">
</DIV>
</EFX_COMPENSATION_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Amounts shown do not reflect cash compensation actually received by the named executive officer.&#160; Instead, the amounts shown are the non-cash aggregate grant date fair values of stock option and RSU awards made during the periods presented as determined pursuant to ASC Topic 718 and excludes the effect of forfeiture assumptions.&#160; Also, these awards generally vest over a four-year period from the date of grant.&#160; The assumptions used to calculate the fair value of stock option and RSU awards are set forth under Note 2 to the Consolidated Financial Statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Represent discretionary cash bonuses granted by the Compensation Committee on February&nbsp;27, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	38
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_38_115640_3020">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\108738\16-4734-1\TASK7785298\4734-1-BO.HTM',USER='108738',CD='FEB 17 22:34 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The objective of our executive compensation program is to attract, motivate and retain talented executives with related technical and business expertise in the competitive diagnostic laboratory market have a demonstrated ability to effectively grow revenue and control costs.&#160; We hope to retain our executives over the long term to provide continuity from year-to-year.&#160; Consequently, we have chosen to compensate our executives with a salary and, in some cases, with stock option awards, RSU awards and bonuses in order to align the executive&#146;s interests with corporate success.&#160; In addition, since 2012, our executive stock option and RSU awards are generally granted with a four year vesting schedule in order to incentivize our executives to continue to invest their time and energy to ensure our collective success over a longer term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In determining the total amount and mixture of the compensation for each of our named executive officers, our Compensation Committee subjectively evaluates each named executive in light of numerous factors including title and role, individual performance (including past and expected future contribution to our business objectives) and our long term business needs and goals (including the need to attract and retain key management personnel). Our Compensation Committee reviews the performance of each named executive officer annually and determines whether the named executive officer should receive an increase in base salary and/or receive an equity award based on such evaluation. In February&nbsp;2014, we increased Mr.&nbsp;McDonough&#146;s salary in connection with his service as our President and Chief Executive Officer and also increased Mr.&nbsp;Burell&#146;s salary in connection with his service as our Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer and Secretary.&#160; In February&nbsp;2015, we increased Mr.&nbsp;McDonough&#146;s salary to $350,000 and granted cash bonuses to Messrs.&nbsp;McDonough and Burell of $25,000 and $10,000, respectively, for performance-related reasons.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Severance and Change in Control
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We provide certain severance benefits such that if an executive officer of CombiMatrix is terminated for other than cause, death or disability, the executive will receive payments equal to three months&#146; base salary plus medical and dental benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our Board of Directors adopted a Restated Executive Change of Control Severance Plan (the &#147;Severance Plan&#148;) that affects certain of our senior management-level employees who are classified as &#147;Section&nbsp;16 Officers&#148; of the Company.&nbsp; Pursuant to the Severance Plan, if a participating employee is involuntarily&nbsp;terminated (other than for death, disability or for cause) or resigns for &#147;good reason&#148; (as defined in the Severance Plan) during the two-year period following a &#147;change of control&#148; (as defined in the Severance Plan), then, subject to execution of a release of claims against us, the employee will be entitled to receive: (i)&nbsp;a cash severance payment equal to one-half times annual base salary (one times salary for the CEO), in the case of other participating employees; (ii)&nbsp;immediate vesting of outstanding compensatory equity awards; and (iii)&nbsp;payment of COBRA premiums for the participating employee and eligible dependents for a pre-determined period of time.&nbsp; Payment of benefits under the Severance Plan&nbsp;will be&nbsp;limited by provisions contained in Section&nbsp;409A of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;).&nbsp; The Severance Plan is administered by a plan administrator, which initially is the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors.&nbsp; In order to participate in the Severance Plan, an eligible employee must waive any prior retention or severance agreements.&#160; The Severance Plan automatically renews annually unless terminated upon 12 months prior written notice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December&nbsp;2, 2015, our Board of Directors adopted a Transaction Bonus Plan (the &#147;Transaction Bonus Plan&#148;).&#160; The Transaction Bonus Plan provides for certain bonus payments to be made, upon the consummation of a qualifying change of control transaction, to certain employees of the Company as shall be determined from time to time by the Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors.&#160; The aggregate value of the bonuses payable under the Transaction Bonus Plan shall not exceed the greater of (i)&nbsp;$1,000,000 or (ii)&nbsp;ten percent of the net proceeds received in connection with a qualifying change of control transaction, and the percentage of such bonus pool awarded to each eligible participant shall be determined from time to time by our Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2006 Stock Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;), as amended, provides for the grant of incentive or non-statutory stock options and other stock awards to our employees, directors and consultants. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the net number of authorized but unissued shares under the Plan was 194,039, with options to purchase 69,995 shares of common stock and unvested RSUs of 38,795 shares of common stock remained outstanding, respectively, leaving 85,249 shares available to grant under the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The 2006 Stock Incentive Plan is administered by our Compensation Committee.&#160; Subject to the provisions of the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committee determines who will receive the options or RSUs, the number of options or RSUs granted, and the manner of exercise and the exercise price of the options.&#160; The term of incentive stock options granted under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan may not exceed ten years, or five years for options granted to an optionee owning more than 10% of our voting stock.&#160; The exercise price of any stock option granted under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan must be equal to or greater than the fair market value of the shares of our common stock on the date the option is granted.&#160; However, an incentive stock option granted to an optionee owning more than 10% of our voting stock must have an exercise price equal to or greater than 110% of the fair market value of our common stock on the date the option is granted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	39
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_39_122227_48">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 22.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-22.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	All awards were granted under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan. The options were granted at an exercise price equal to the closing price of our common stock on the date of grant and have a term of ten years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 22.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-22.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	These options were granted on October&nbsp;19, 2012 and vest in four equal annual installments over a four-year period measured from the vesting commencement date of August&nbsp;20, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 22.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-22.5PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	Represents 6,845 RSUs granted on February&nbsp;20, 2014 and 11,136 RSUs granted on January&nbsp;9, 2015.&#160; These RSU&#146;s vest in four equal annual installments over a four-year period from the grant date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Compliance with Code Section&nbsp;162(m)
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Section&nbsp;162(m)&nbsp;of the Code (&#147;Section&nbsp;162(m)&#148;) generally disallows a tax deduction to a publicly traded company for compensation in excess of $1 million paid to each of that company&#146;s chief executive officer and four other most highly compensated executive officers.&#160; Qualifying performance-based compensation is not subject to the deduction limit if certain requirements are met.&#160; In the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, none of our executive officers received compensation in excess of $1 million.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_COMPENSATION>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 12.&#160;&#160; SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_ITEM12_SECURITYOWNERSHIPOFCERTAI_124154">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following table shows information regarding the beneficial ownership of our common stock as of January&nbsp;31, 2016 by (a)&nbsp;each stockholder, or group of affiliated stockholders, that we know owns more than 5% of our outstanding common stock; (b)&nbsp;each of our named executive officers; (c)&nbsp;each of our directors; and (d)&nbsp;all of our current directors and executive officers as a group. The table is based upon information supplied by directors, executive officers and principal stockholders, and Schedules 13D and 13G filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Percentage ownership in the table below is based on 851,081 shares of common stock outstanding as of January&nbsp;31, 2016. Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with the rules&nbsp;of the Securities and Exchange Commission, and generally includes voting power and/or investment power with respect to the securities held. Any securities not outstanding but which are subject to options or warrants exercisable within 60 days of January&nbsp;31, 2016 are deemed outstanding and beneficially owned for the purpose of computing the percentage of outstanding common stock beneficially owned by the stockholder holding such options or warrants, but are not deemed outstanding for the purpose of computing the percentage of common stock beneficially owned by any other stockholder.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Unless otherwise indicated, each of the stockholders listed below has sole voting and investment power with respect to the shares beneficially owned. The address for each director or named executive officer is c/o CombiMatrix Corporation, 310 Goddard, Suite&nbsp;150,&nbsp;Irvine, California 92618.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;

	The securities held by Alpha Capital Anstalt are subject to a blocker that would prevent Alpha Capital Anstalt&#146;s ownership at any given time from exceeding 9.99% of our outstanding common stock. Absent this blocker and assuming all such securities are convertible or exercisable within 60 days of January&nbsp;31, 2016, Alpha Capital Anstalt would beneficially own an aggregate of 411,812 shares, or 48%, of our common stock, consisting of an aggregate of 18,965 shares of common stock, 40 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock financing, 6 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of additional warrants issued in June&nbsp;2014, 18,334 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;B preferred stock financing, 54,646 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;C preferred stock financing, 129,450 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;D preferred stock financing, 68,463 shares of common stock issuable upon conversion of Series&nbsp;E preferred stock, 38,096 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;E preferred stock financing and 83,811 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of private placement warrants issued in April&nbsp;2015. Konrad Ackermann has voting and investment power over such shares beneficially owned by Alpha Capital Anstalt. The reported mailing address for Alpha Capital Anstalt is Pradafant 7, Furstentums 9490, Vaduz, Liechtenstein. Information based upon investor filings with the SEC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(10)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The securities held by the entities affiliated with Acuta Capital Partners, LLC (formerly Longwood Capital Partners, LLC) are subject to a blocker that would prevent the exercise and/or conversion of such securities if such entities&#146; aggregate ownership at any given time would exceed 4.99% of our outstanding common stock after such exercise and/or conversion. Absent such blocker and assuming all such securities are convertible or exercisable within 60 days of January&nbsp;31, 2016, the entities affiliated with Acuta Capital Partners, LLC together would beneficially own an aggregate of 102,787 shares, or 12.1%, of our common stock, consisting of an aggregate of 59,576 shares of common stock, 19,417 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;D preferred stock financing, 8,557 shares of common stock issuable upon conversion of Series&nbsp;E preferred stock, 4,761 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;E preferred stock financing and 10,476 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of private placement warrants issued in April&nbsp;2015. Of these amounts, absent the blocker and assuming all such securities are convertible or exercisable within 60 days of January&nbsp;31, 2016, Acuta Capital, LP would beneficially own an aggregate of 50,798 shares, or 5.97%, of our common stock, consisting of 29,261 shares of common stock, 8,418 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;D preferred stock financing, 4,707 shares of common stock issuable upon conversion of Series&nbsp;E preferred stock, 2,619 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;E preferred stock financing and 5,793 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of private placement warrants issued in April&nbsp;2015; Acuta Opportunity Fund, LP would beneficially own an aggregate of 19,159 shares, or 2.25%, of our common stock, consisting of 8,954 shares of common stock, 4,527 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;D preferred stock financing, 2,054 shares of common stock issuable upon conversion of Series&nbsp;E preferred stock, 1,142 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;E preferred stock financing and 2,482 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of private placement warrants issued in April&nbsp;2015; and 2B LLC would beneficially own an aggregate of 32,829 shares, or 3.86%, of our common stock, consisting of 21,360 shares of common stock, 6,472 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;D preferred stock financing, 1,797 shares of common stock issuable upon conversion of Series&nbsp;E preferred stock, 1,000 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of warrants issued in our Series&nbsp;E preferred stock financing and 2,200 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of private placement warrants issued in April&nbsp;2015. Richard Lin is the Managing Member of Acuta Capital Partners, LLC, which has voting and investment power over all of the shares beneficially owned by Acuta Capital, LP, Acuta Opportunity Fund, LP and 2B LLC. Mr.&nbsp;Lin disclaims beneficial ownership over all of the shares beneficially owned by Acuta Capital, LP, Acuta Opportunity Fund, LP and 2B LLC, except to the extent of his pecuniary interest therein. The reported mailing address for Acuta Capital Partners, LLC is 1301 Shoreway Road, Suite&nbsp;350, Belmont, California 94002. Information based upon investor filings with the SEC.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 13.&#160; CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS, AND DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_ITEM13_CERTAINRELATIONSHIPSANDRE_124203">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Transactions with Management and Others
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Since January&nbsp;1, 2015, there has not been, nor has there been proposed, any transaction, arrangement or relationship or series of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships, including those involving indebtedness not in the ordinary course of business, to which we or our subsidiaries were or are a party, or in which we or our subsidiaries were or are a participant, in which the amount involved exceeded or exceeds the lesser of $120,000 or 1% of the average of our total assets at year-end for the last two completed fiscal years and in which any of our directors, nominees for director, executive officers, beneficial owners of more than 5% of any class of our voting securities or any member of the immediate family of any of the foregoing persons, had or will have a direct or indirect material interest, other than as described above under Part&nbsp;III, item 11 and other than the transactions described below. Each of the transactions described below was reviewed and approved or ratified by our Audit Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On January&nbsp;9, 2015, pursuant to the authority granted under our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, our Compensation Committee granted 11,136 restricted stock units to our Chief Executive Officer, Mark McDonough, 5,568 restricted stock units to our Chief Financial Officer, Scott Burell, and 835 restricted stock units to each of our non-employee Board members.&#160; 25% of the shares of common stock subject to the restricted stock units vest on each anniversary of the grant date over a four year period. The restricted stock units may vest on an accelerated basis in accordance with the terms of our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan and our Restated Executive Change of Control Severance Plan and, in the event of death or a permanent disability, the vesting of the restricted stock unit will accelerate by twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On February&nbsp;13, 2015, we entered into a securities purchase agreement (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement&#148;) with certain accredited institutional pre-existing investors (the &#147;Investors&#148;), including Alpha Capital Anstalt, Acuta Capital Partners (formerly Longwood Capital Partners) and Perkins Capital Management, pursuant to which we sold an aggregate of up to 102,800 shares (the &#147;Common Shares&#148;) of common stock at a price of $26.25 per share, an aggregate of up to 2,201.493 shares of Series&nbsp;E 6% Convertible Preferred Stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock&#148;) and warrants to purchase up to an aggregate of 46,676 shares of common stock at an exercise price of $29.55 per share (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Warrants&#148;, and the transactions contemplated by the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement, the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Financing&#148;).&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants were sold in a fixed combination consisting of one share of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and a Series&nbsp;E Warrant to purchase approximately 21.1977 shares of common stock.&#160; Each fixed combination of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants was sold at a price of $1,000.00.&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock is convertible into an aggregate of 83,871 shares of common stock at an initial conversion price of $26.25 per share.&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock is not convertible into greater than 19.99% (when aggregated with the Common Shares) of our outstanding common stock unless stockholder approval is obtained. The Investors have agreed to be subject to a blocker that would prevent each of their respective common stock ownership at any given time from exceeding 9.99% of our outstanding common stock. The net proceeds to us from the sale and
</FONT>
</FONT>
	issuance of the Common Shares, Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants, after deducting the offering expenses borne by us, and excluding the proceeds, if any, from the exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants, were approximately $4.7 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	43
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_43_123306_455">

<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Each share of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock carried a 6% per annum dividend that would begin accruing six months after the closing under the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement and would be payable only in cash, but these dividends have been waived for all time by the holders of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock, as described below.&#160; Until the volume weighted average price of our common stock on Nasdaq exceeds 200% of the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock for ten consecutive trading days, the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock is subject to full ratchet price based anti-dilution protection (subject to the limits imposed by General Instruction I.B.6. of Form&nbsp;S-3).&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Warrants have a 5 &#189; year term and have a cashless exercise provision in the event there is no effective registration statement covering the common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants. The Series&nbsp;E Warrants are not exercisable for the first six months following issuance.&#160; Subject to the beneficial ownership limitation described above, if, after the one year anniversary of the closing, the volume weighted average price of our common stock on Nasdaq exceeds 200% of the exercise price for ten consecutive trading days, then we have the right to, within one trading day thereafter, call for cancellation of up to 50% of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants for consideration equal to $0.001 per share of common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;E Warrants.&#160; We may not exercise our call rights if, among other things, there is no effective registration statement registering the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants or the prospectus contained in the registration statement is not available for the issuance of the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We also agreed with the Investors that while such Investor holds Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants, we will not effect or enter into an agreement to effect a &#147;Variable Rate Transaction,&#148; which means a transaction in which we: (i)&nbsp;issue or sell any convertible securities either (A)&nbsp;at a conversion, exercise or exchange rate or other price that is based upon and/or varies with the trading prices of, or quotations for, the shares of common stock at any time after the initial issuance of such convertible securities, or (B)&nbsp;with a conversion, exercise or exchange price that is subject to being reset at some future date after the initial issuance of such convertible securities or upon the occurrence of specified or contingent events directly or indirectly related to our business; or (ii)&nbsp;enter into any agreement (including, without limitation, an equity line of credit) whereby we may sell securities at a future determined price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We also agreed with the Investors that, except under certain permitted circumstances: (i)&nbsp;until the later of the date that is six months from the closing or 30 days following the date on which less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock remains outstanding, we will not issue, or enter into any agreement to issue, any shares of common stock or equivalents thereof; (ii)&nbsp;until the time that less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants remain outstanding, neither we nor our subsidiaries will issue, or enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the exercise price of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants; (iii)&nbsp;until the time that less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock remains outstanding, neither we nor our subsidiaries will issue, or enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock unless all shares of common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock (taking into consideration the effect of the full adjustment of the anti-dilution provisions from such dilutive issuance) are permitted by General Instruction I.B.6. of Form&nbsp;S-3 to be issued under the registration statement; (iv)&nbsp;if we issue or agree to issue securities within the six months following the closing under the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement, and subject to the preexisting rights of other security holders, the Investors shall have the right of first refusal to purchase all of the securities on the same terms, conditions and price provided for in the proposed issuance of securities; and (v)&nbsp;we will indemnify the Investors against certain losses resulting from our breach of any of our representations, warranties, or covenants under agreements with the Investors, as well as under certain other circumstances described in the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Substantially concurrently with the closing of the Series&nbsp;E Financing, on February&nbsp;13, 2015, we entered into a separate securities purchase agreement (the &#147;Warrant Purchase Agreement&#148;) with selected accredited institutional pre-existing investors (the &#147;Private Placement Investors&#148;), including Alpha Capital Anstalt, Acuta Capital Partners (formerly Longwood Capital Partners) and Perkins Capital Management, pursuant to which we will sell to the Private Placement Investors warrants to purchase up to an aggregate of 102,678 shares of Common Stock (the &#147;Private Placement Warrants&#148;, and the transactions contemplated by the Warrant Purchase Agreement, the &#147;Warrant Financing&#148;).&#160; In consideration of an aggregate of $1,000, we agreed to sell the Private Placement Warrants, which were issued on April&nbsp;29, 2015 after our stockholders approved amending our Certificate of Incorporation to increase our authorized common stock in an amount sufficient to permit the issuance of the common stock issuable upon exercise of the Private Placement Warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">

</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Each Private Placement Warrant has an exercise price of $32.505 per share of common stock (subject to adjustment for stock splits and the like), and will be exercisable at any time after the six month anniversary of entering into the Warrant Purchase Agreement and on or prior to the close of business on the five year anniversary of the initial exercise date, subject to the beneficial ownership limitation described below.&#160; If, at the time of exercise of a Private Placement Warrant, there is no effective registration statement registering for resale the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Private Placement Warrant, the holder may exercise the Private Placement Warrant on a cashless basis.&#160; Subject to the beneficial ownership limitation described below, if, after the one year anniversary of the date of entering into the Warrant Purchase Agreement, the volume weighted average price of our common stock on Nasdaq exceeds 200% of the Private Placement Warrant exercise price for ten consecutive trading days, then we may, within one trading day thereafter, call for cancellation of up to 50% of the Private Placement Warrants for consideration equal to $0.001 per share of common stock underlying the Private Placement Warrants.&#160; We may not exercise our call rights if, among other things, there is no effective registration statement registering for resale the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Private Placement Warrants.&#160; Subject to limited exceptions, a holder of Private Placement Warrants will not have the right to exercise any portion of its Private Placement Warrants if the holder, together with its affiliates, would beneficially own in excess of 4.99% (which may be increased, but not above 9.99%) of the number of shares of our common stock outstanding immediately after giving effect to such exercise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For as long as the Private Placement Investors hold any Private Placement Warrants, we will not effect or enter into an agreement to effect a &#147;Variable Rate Transaction,&#148; which means a transaction in which we: (i)&nbsp;issue or sell any convertible securities either (A)&nbsp;at a conversion, exercise or exchange rate or other price that is based upon and/or varies with the trading prices of, or quotations for, the shares of the common stock at any time after the initial issuance of such convertible securities, or (B)&nbsp;with a conversion, exercise or exchange price that is subject to being reset at some future date after the initial issuance of such convertible securities or upon the occurrence of specified or contingent events directly or indirectly related to our business; or (ii)&nbsp;enter into any agreement (including, without limitation, an equity line of credit) whereby we may sell securities at a future determined price.&#160; We also agreed with the Private Placement Investors that, except under certain permitted circumstances until the time that less than 7.5% of the Private Placement Warrants remain outstanding, neither we nor our subsidiaries shall issue, or enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the exercise price of the Private Placement Warrants. We also agreed that the terms of the Warrant Financing will be amended to the reflect the most favorable terms obtained by us in any future equity financing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In connection with the purchase of the Private Placement Warrants, we agreed to modify previously issued and outstanding warrants held by the Private Placement Investors that were issued on October&nbsp;1, 2012, March&nbsp;20, 2013, May&nbsp;6, 2013 and June&nbsp;28, 2013, to (i)&nbsp;reduce the exercise prices thereunder to $29.55 and (ii)&nbsp;prohibit the exercise of such modified warrants for a period of six months after the date of the modification and (iii)&nbsp;extend the exercise period of such modified warrants for an additional six months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On October&nbsp;12, 2015, we entered into an Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Common Stock Purchase Warrants with each of the holders of (i)&nbsp;the Series&nbsp;E Warrants and (ii)&nbsp;100,847 of the Private Placement Warrants, to reduce the exercise prices of such warrants to $16.50 per share.&#160; In consideration for entering into such amendments of these warrants, each holder of these warrants agreed to irrevocably waive
<I>
	ab initio
</I>
	and for all time its right to receive cash dividends on its shares of our Series&nbsp;E 6% Convertible Preferred Stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On February&nbsp;4, 2016, we entered into a Series&nbsp;E 6% Convertible Preferred Stock Repurchase Agreement (the &#147;Repurchase Agreement&#148;) with the holders of our outstanding Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock.&#160; Pursuant to the terms of the Repurchase Agreement, we agreed to pay each holder $300 per share of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock in consideration for the right to repurchase such holder&#146;s Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock at a price per share of $1,000 (the &#147;Repurchase Price&#148;), which was the original price per share paid by the holders for their Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock in February&nbsp;2015.&#160; We must repurchase the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock within one business day after closing our underwritten public offering.&#160; In connection with entering into the Repurchase Agreement, we were granted certain consents and waivers relating the public offering.&#160; In the event that our public offering is not consummated by the date set forth in the Repurchase Agreement, the Repurchase Agreement will terminate and we will not be obligated to repurchase the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
