<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:20.3PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Rent expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was $258,000 and $288,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Executive Severance
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We provide certain severance benefits such that if an executive officer of CombiMatrix Corporation is terminated for other than cause, death or disability, the executive will receive payments equal to three months&#146; base salary plus medical and dental benefits.&#160; In addition, we have implemented a Restated Executive Change of Control Severance Plan (as amended, the &#147;Severance Plan&#148;) that affects certain of our senior management-level employees who are classified as &#147;Section&nbsp;16 Officers&#148; of the Company.&nbsp; Pursuant to the Severance Plan, if a participating employee is involuntarily&nbsp;terminated (other than for death, disability or for cause) or resigns for &#147;good reason&#148; (as defined in the Severance Plan) during the two-year period following a &#147;change of control&#148; (as defined in the Severance Plan) of the Company, then, subject to execution of a release of claims against the Company, the employee will be entitled to receive: (i)&nbsp;one-half times annual base salary (one times annual base salary for the CEO); (ii)&nbsp;immediate vesting of outstanding compensatory equity awards; and (iii)&nbsp;payment of COBRA premiums for the participating employee and eligible dependents for a pre-determined period of time.&nbsp; Payment of benefits under the Severance Plan&nbsp;will be&nbsp;limited by provisions contained in Section&nbsp;409A of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code.&nbsp; The Severance Plan is administered by a plan administrator, which initially is the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors.&nbsp; In order to participate in the Severance Plan, an eligible employee must waive any prior retention or severance agreements.&#160; The Severance Plan automatically renews annually unless terminated upon 12 months prior written notice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December&nbsp;2, 2015, our Board of Directors adopted a Transaction Bonus Plan (the &#147;Transaction Bonus Plan&#148;).&#160; The Transaction Bonus Plan provides for certain bonus payments to be made, upon the consummation of a qualifying change of control transaction, to certain employees of the Company as shall be determined from time to time by the Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors.&#160; The aggregate value of the bonuses payable under the Transaction Bonus Plan shall not exceed the greater of (i)&nbsp;$1,000,000 or (ii)&nbsp;ten percent of the net proceeds received in connection with a qualifying change of control transaction, and the percentage of such bonus pool awarded to each eligible participant shall be determined from time to time by our Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	17
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_17_125129_5335">
</A>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Litigation
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2002, we entered into a settlement agreement with Nanogen,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;Nanogen&#148;) to settle all pending litigation between the parties.&#160; Pursuant to the terms of the settlement agreement, we agreed to make quarterly payments to Nanogen equal to 12.5% of total sales of products developed by us and our affiliates based on the patents that had been in dispute in the litigation, up to an annual maximum amount of $1.5 million.&#160; The minimum quarterly payments under the settlement agreement are $25,000 per quarter until the patents expire in 2018.&#160; Royalty expenses recognized under the agreement were $100,000 in each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, and are included in patent amortization and royalties in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On February&nbsp;14, 2011, Relator Michael Strathmann (&#147;Strathmann&#148;) served us with a complaint (&#147;the Complaint&#148;) filed in the Superior Court of the State of California, County of Orange (the &#147;Superior Court&#148;).&#160; The Complaint alleged we and our former parent Acacia Research Corporation submitted a false and fraudulent insurance claim to National Union Fire Insurance Company under a Directors and Officers Policy issued to Acacia, in connection with a prior lawsuit that was settled with Nanogen,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; The Complaint further alleged that we violated the California Insurance Fraud Prevention Act, and sought penalties and unspecified damages.&#160; On May&nbsp;4, 2011, the Superior Court dismissed the Complaint by ordering that it be stricken for violation of the California Anti-SLAPP statute, which prevents plaintiffs from filing abusive lawsuits against public policy.&#160; On June&nbsp;15, 2011, Strathmann filed a Notice of Appeal with the California Court of Appeal, appealing the granting of our Anti-SLAPP Motion.&#160; On October&nbsp;24, 2012, the California Court of Appeal reversed the Superior Court&#146;s dismissal, finding that the Anti-SLAPP statute was not applicable as a matter of public policy and remanded the case back to the Superior Court.&#160; Strathmann filed an Amended Complaint, and we and Acacia filed our Answer to that pleading.&#160; A trial was held between June&nbsp;and August&nbsp;of 2014, followed by closing briefs and arguments filed in September&nbsp;and October&nbsp;of 2014.&#160; On January&nbsp;2, 2015, the Superior Court issued a tentative ruling and proposed statement of decision in favor of us, Acacia and Amit Kumar and against all claims of Strathmann.&#160; Specifically, the Superior Court determined that it could not find we had any fraudulent intent when we pursued insurance benefits under the National Union Directors and Officers Policy over a decade ago.&#160; On March&nbsp;6, 2015, the Superior Court issued its final Statement of Decision, confirming its tentative ruling that Strathmann failed to prove that we (or any other defendant) had a fraudulent intent when we pursued insurance benefits from National Union.&#160; Also on March&nbsp;6, 2015, the Superior Court entered a Judgment in favor of all defendants and against Strathmann, and ordered that Strathmann&#146;s Complaint be dismissed with prejudice.&#160; A Notice of Entry of Judgment was filed with the Superior Court on March&nbsp;11, 2015.&#160; On April&nbsp;23, 2015, we entered into a settlement agreement with Strathmann whereby Strathmann relinquished his rights to further litigate the Complaint or appeal the Judgment.&#160; In return, we relinquished our rights to recover certain court costs and to pursue reimbursement of court and legal fees from Strathmann, effectively ending this litigation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	From time to time, we are subject to other claims and legal actions that arise in the ordinary course of business.&#160; We believe that the ultimate liability with respect to these claims and legal actions, if any, will not have a material effect on our financial position, results of operations or cash flows.&#160; Any legal costs resulting from claims or legal actions are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	10.
</FONT>
</B>
	&#160;
<B>
	RETIREMENT SAVINGS PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.3PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have an employee savings and retirement plan under section 401(k)&nbsp;of the Internal Revenue Code (the &#147;Retirement Plan&#148;).&#160; The Retirement Plan is a defined contribution plan in which eligible employees may elect to have a percentage of their compensation contributed to the Retirement Plan, subject to certain guidelines issued by the Internal Revenue Service.&#160; We may contribute to the Retirement Plan at the discretion of our board of directors.&#160; There were no contributions made by us during any of the years presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	11.&#160; STOCKHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On April&nbsp;28, 2015, our stockholders approved all ballot measures of a special meeting proxy, which included the approval and ratification of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock financing described below as well as the approval to increase our authorized capital stock from 25 million shares to 50 million shares.&#160; Our authorized capital was not affected by the Reverse Stock Split.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On June&nbsp;17, 2015, our stockholders approved all ballot measures of our annual meeting proxy, which included an increase to the common stock share reserves under our 2006 Stock Incentive plan from 133,333 shares to 200,000 shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As previously discussed above, on January&nbsp;29, 2016, we filed a Certificate of Amendment to our Certificate of Incorporation with the Secretary of State of the State of Delaware to effect the one-for-fifteen Reverse Stock Split.&#160; The following discussion regarding shares of common stock and per share amounts are reflective of the Reverse Stock Split.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	18
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_18_125213_5796">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-18',FILE='C:\JMS\105568\16-4734-1\TASK7786486\4734-1-FP.HTM',USER='105568',CD='FEB 18 06:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series&nbsp;A Convertible Preferred Stock and Warrants Financing
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During the fourth quarter of 2012, we issued Series&nbsp;A convertible preferred stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;A Stock&#148;) and warrants to purchase common stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;A Warrants&#148;) to certain accredited investors (the &#147;Series&nbsp;A Investors&#148;) for gross proceeds of $2.5 million.&#160; During the fourth quarter of 2012 and the first quarter of 2013, all of the Series&nbsp;A Stock converted into 83,000 shares of common stock, and during 2013, 80,000 shares of common stock were issued from the exercise of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants, leaving Series&nbsp;A Warrants to purchase approximately 20,000 shares of common stock unexercised as of December&nbsp;31, 2013.&#160;&#160; During 2014, Series&nbsp;A Investors exercised Series&nbsp;A Warrants to purchase 8,274 shares of our common stock, resulting in proceeds of $256,000 to us.&#160; The Series&nbsp;A Warrants originally had a 5&#189; year term, price anti-dilution protection and exercise prices of $142.50 (from the first closing) and $35.40 (from the second closing).&#160; See below for further discussion of modifications made to the Series&nbsp;A Warrants as a result of the Series&nbsp;D preferred stock financing and private placement warrants financing executed in December&nbsp;2013 and February&nbsp;2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For as long as the Series&nbsp;A Warrants remain unexercised through their expiration date, we may not sell securities at an effective price per share of less than $73.65 except for certain exempt issuances, unless waivers from the Series&nbsp;A Investors are obtained.&#160; Also, prior to a modification we made to the Series&nbsp;A Warrants in June&nbsp;2014 (the &#147;Modification&#148;) the exercise price of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants and the number of shares of common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;A Warrants were subject to full-ratchet anti-dilution adjustments in the event we issued securities, other than certain exempted issuances, at a price below the then current exercise price of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We account for stock purchase warrants as either equity instruments or derivative liabilities depending on the specific terms of the warrant agreements.&#160; Under applicable accounting guidance, stock warrants must be accounted for as derivative financial instruments if the warrants contain full-ratchet anti-dilution provisions, which preclude the warrants from being considered indexed to our own stock.&#160; Prior to June&nbsp;2014 (the &#147;Modification Date&#148;), the Series&nbsp;A Warrants issued to Series&nbsp;A Investors contained such provisions, thus requiring us to treat them as derivative financial instruments, to be recorded at fair value at each reporting date, with the corresponding adjustment reflected as a non-operating credit or charge in the consolidated statement of operations.&#160; We valued the Series&nbsp;A Warrants using the Monte-Carlo simulation method using the following assumptions immediately prior to the Modification Date:&#160; (i)&nbsp;closing stock price and Series&nbsp;A Warrant contractual exercise price; (ii)&nbsp;term to expiration commensurate with the individual Series&nbsp;A Warrant terms of 3.8 years; (iii)&nbsp;historical volatilities commensurate with the term of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants of 129.6%; (iv)&nbsp;risk-free interest rates commensurate with the term of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants of 1.2%; and (v)&nbsp;simulated anti-dilution impact assuming various probabilities that we will raise additional capital by issuing equity securities at prices above or below the current contractual Series&nbsp;A Warrant exercise prices during the Series&nbsp;A Warrant terms.&#160; The result of this valuation simulation was to value the remaining Series&nbsp;A Warrants held by Series&nbsp;A Investors at $281,000 as of the Modification Date.&#160; As a result, warrant derivative gains of $152,000 were recognized, and the remaining $281,000 was reclassified to additional paid-in capital.&#160; As a result of a similar valuation analysis performed during the first quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2014, the combined warrant derivative gains recognized in our consolidated statements of operations and the amount of warrant derivative liabilities reclassified to stockholders&#146; equity resulting from Series&nbsp;A Warrant exercises for the year-ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $152,000 and $416,000, respectively.&#160; The additional Series&nbsp;A Warrants to purchase 1,687 shares of common stock issued to Series&nbsp;A Investors as consideration for agreeing to the Modification were valued using the Black-Scholes valuation model, using the following assumptions as of the Modification Date:&#160; (i)&nbsp;closing stock price and Series&nbsp;A Warrant contractual exercise price; (ii)&nbsp;term to expiration commensurate with the individual Series&nbsp;A Warrant terms of 3.8 years; (iii)&nbsp;historical volatility commensurate with the term of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants of 129.6%; and (iv)&nbsp;risk-free interest rates commensurate with the term of the Series&nbsp;A Warrants of 1.2%.&#160; The resulting valuation of $44,000 was recognized as a non-operating charge in our consolidated statement of operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	There were no subsequent warrant derivative gains or charges recognized subsequent to the Modification Date in 2014 nor in 2015 as we no longer hold derivative instruments that require mark-to-market accounting
<I>
	.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series&nbsp;B Convertible Preferred Stock Financing
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On March&nbsp;19, 2013, we entered into a securities purchase agreement with an existing institutional investor (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B Investor&#148;) to purchase 8,666 shares of common stock at a price of $45.75 per share and approximately 1,610.4 units consisting of, in the aggregate, Series&nbsp;B 6% convertible preferred stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B Stock&#148;) and warrants to purchase up to 18,333 shares of common stock at an original exercise price of $52.35 per share (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B Warrants&#148;) in a registered direct offering (the &#147;Series&nbsp;B Financing&#148;) of securities sold off of our existing shelf registration statement on Form&nbsp;S-3.&#160; The Series&nbsp;B Financing closed on March&nbsp;20, 2013, netting approximately $1.8 million of proceeds to us.&#160; The Series&nbsp;B Stock was initially convertible into an aggregate of 35,200 shares of common stock at an initial conversion price of $45.75 per share.&#160; During 2013, the Series&nbsp;B Investor converted all of the Series&nbsp;B Stock into common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Series&nbsp;B Warrants originally had a 5&#189; year term as well as a cashless exercise provision in the event there is no effective registration statement covering the common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;B Warrants.&#160; The Series&nbsp;B Warrants are not subject to price anti-dilution protection.&#160; We also agreed with the Series&nbsp;B Investor pursuant to the Series&nbsp;B Purchase Agreement that, except under certain permitted circumstances, until the time that less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;B Warrants remain outstanding, neither we nor our subsidiaries shall issue, or enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the exercise price of the Series&nbsp;B Warrants. See below for further discussion of modifications made to the Series&nbsp;B Warrants as a result of the private placement warrants financing executed in February&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series&nbsp;C Convertible Preferred Stock Financing
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On May&nbsp;3, 2013, we entered into a securities purchase agreement with two accredited investors (the &#147;Series&nbsp;C Investors&#148;), pursuant to which we sold and issued 1,200 shares of Series&nbsp;C 6% convertible preferred stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;C Stock&#148;) to the Series&nbsp;C Investors at a purchase price of $1,000 per share in an initial closing that occurred on May&nbsp;6, 2013 (the &#147;Series&nbsp;C First Closing&#148;) and sold and issued 1,200 additional shares of Series&nbsp;C Stock to the Series&nbsp;C Investors on June&nbsp;28, 2013 at a purchase price of $1,000 per share after stockholder approval was obtained on June&nbsp;27, 2013 (the &#147;Series&nbsp;C Second Closing&#148;) (combined, the &#147;Series&nbsp;C Financing&#148;). After certain offering-related costs paid, the net proceeds from the Series&nbsp;C Financing were approximately $2.14 million.&#160; During 2013, the Series&nbsp;C Investors converted all 2,400 shares of Series&nbsp;C Stock into 55,990 shares of common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In addition to the issuance of the Series&nbsp;C Stock, we issued warrants at the Series&nbsp;C First Closing to purchase 32,788 shares of our common stock with an original exercise price of $56.55 per share and at the Series&nbsp;C Second Closing, we issued additional warrants to purchase 32,788 shares of our common stock with an original exercise price of $53.25 per share (collectively, the &#147;Series&nbsp;C Warrants&#148;).&#160; The Series&nbsp;C Warrants originally had a
</FONT>
	5&#189;
</FONT>
	year term, were not exercisable for the first six months following issuance and included a cashless exercise provision, which is only applicable if the common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;C Warrants is not subject to an effective registration statement or otherwise cannot be sold without restriction pursuant to Rule&nbsp;144.&#160; Until all Series&nbsp;C Investors no longer hold Series&nbsp;C Warrants:&#160; (i)&nbsp;we may not sell any variable rate securities except for certain exempt issuances; and (ii)&nbsp;if we enter into a subsequent financing on more favorable terms than the Series&nbsp;C Financing, then the agreements between us and the Series&nbsp;C Investors will be amended to include such more favorable terms.&#160; In addition, until 7.5% or less of the Series&nbsp;C Warrants remain unexercised, we may not sell any dilutive securities, except for certain exempt issuances.&#160; See below for further discussion of modifications made to the Series&nbsp;C Warrants as a result of the private placement warrants financing executed in February&nbsp;2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series&nbsp;D Convertible Preferred Stock Financing
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December&nbsp;20, 2013 (the &#147;Series&nbsp;D Closing&#148;), we closed an underwritten public offering (the &#147;Series&nbsp;D Offering&#148;) and issued 12,000 units of securities to investors, with each unit consisting of: (i)&nbsp;one share of Series&nbsp;D preferred stock (&#147;Series&nbsp;D Stock&#148;) convertible into shares of our common stock equal to 1,000 divided by the conversion price of $30.90, which was 72.5% of the consolidated closing bid price of our common stock on the Nasdaq Capital Market on December&nbsp;16, 2013, the date we executed the underwriting agreement (&#147;UA date&#148;); and (ii)&nbsp;one warrant exercisable for 32.3625 shares of our common stock, at an exercise price per share equal to $46.80 (&#147;Series&nbsp;D Warrants&#148;), which was 110% of the consolidated closing bid price of our common stock on the Nasdaq Capital Market on the UA date. The shares of common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;D Stock and Series&nbsp;D Warrants were registered on Form&nbsp;S-1, which was declared effective by the SEC on December&nbsp;16, 2013. The Series&nbsp;D Stock was immediately convertible and the Series&nbsp;D Warrants were immediately exercisable for shares of common stock and have a term of five years. The Series&nbsp;D Warrants are exercisable for cash or, solely in the absence of an effective registration statement or prospectus, by cashless exercise. In total, there were 388,365 shares of common stock issuable upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;D Stock and up to 388,365 shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;D Warrants. The units were sold for a purchase price equal to $1,000 per unit, resulting in net proceeds received by us of $10.7 million.&#160; From the time of the Series&nbsp;D Closing through the first quarter of 2014, all of the Series&nbsp;D Stock had converted into 388,365 shares of common stock. Also as a result of the Series&nbsp;D Offering, the exercise price of the then outstanding Series&nbsp;A Warrants automatically ratcheted down by their terms from their then exercise price of $42.90 per share to an adjusted exercise price of $30.90 per share, and the underlying shares exercisable was automatically increased by 5,460 shares.&#160; A registration statement on Form&nbsp;S-3 was filed in order to register these additional shares for resale pursuant to the terms of our original Series&nbsp;A offering documents
</FONT>
	. The Series&nbsp;E convertible preferred stock financing described below did not impact any of the terms of the Series&nbsp;D Warrants currently outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	20
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_20_125322_3020">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series&nbsp;E Convertible Preferred Stock Financing
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On February&nbsp;13, 2015, we and certain accredited institutional pre-existing investors (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Investors&#148;) entered into a securities purchase agreement (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement&#148;), pursuant to which we sold 102,800 shares common stock at a price of $26.25 per share, 2,201.493 shares of Series&nbsp;E 6% Convertible Preferred Stock (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock&#148;) and warrants to purchase 46,676 shares of common stock initially at an exercise price of $29.55 per share, which was the consolidated closing bid price of our common stock on Nasdaq immediately prior to entering into the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Warrants&#148;, and the transactions contemplated by the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement, the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Financing&#148;).&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants were sold in a fixed combination consisting of one share of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and a Series&nbsp;E Warrant to purchase approximately 21.1977 shares of common stock.&#160; Each fixed combination of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants were sold at a price of $1,000.&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock sold is convertible into 83,871 shares of common stock at an initial conversion price of $26.25 per share.&#160; The closing under the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement occurred on February&nbsp;18, 2015 (the &#147;Series&nbsp;E Closing Date&#148;), where we received gross proceeds of $4.9 million from the Series&nbsp;E Investors.&#160; After closing-related costs and expenses, net proceeds from the Series&nbsp;E Financing were approximately $4.7 million.&#160; Given that the effective conversion price of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock, inclusive of amounts allocated to common stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants, was below the closing market price of our common stock at the time of the Series&nbsp;E Closing Date, we recognized a beneficial conversion feature in the amount of $890,000.&#160; Since the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock was immediately convertible into common stock, the beneficial conversion feature was treated as a deemed dividend charged to retained earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock is non-voting (except to the extent required by law and except for certain consent rights relating to amending the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, and the like), but ranks senior to our common stock with respect to dividends and with respect to distributions upon our deemed dissolution, liquidation or winding-up.&#160; Each share of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock had initially carried a 6% per annum dividend that would begin accruing six months after the Series&nbsp;E Closing Date and would be payable only in cash, but these dividends have been waived for all time by the holders of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock, as described below.&#160; Until the volume weighted average price of our common stock on Nasdaq exceeds 200% of the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock for ten consecutive trading days, the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock is subject to full ratchet price based anti-dilution protection, subject to certain limitations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Series&nbsp;E Warrants issued have a 5 &#189; year term and have a cashless exercise provision in the event there is no effective registration statement covering the common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants. The Series&nbsp;E Warrants are not exercisable for the first six months following issuance.&#160; The Series&nbsp;E Warrants are not subject to price based anti-dilution protection.&#160; Subject to the beneficial ownership limitation described below, if, after the one year anniversary of the Series&nbsp;E Closing Date, the volume weighted average price of our common stock on Nasdaq exceeds 200% of the exercise price for ten consecutive trading days, then we have the right to, within one trading day thereafter, call for cancellation of up to 50% of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants for consideration equal to $0.001 per share of common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;E Warrants.&#160; We may not exercise our call rights if, among other things, there is no effective registration statement registering the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants or the prospectus contained in the registration statement is not available for the issuance of the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Pursuant to the terms of the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement, while such Series&nbsp;E Investor holds Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and Series&nbsp;E Warrants, we may not enter into an agreement to effect a &#147;Variable Rate Transaction,&#148; which means a transaction in which we: (i)&nbsp;issue or sell any convertible securities either (A)&nbsp;at a conversion, exercise or exchange rate or other price that is based upon and/or varies with the trading prices of, or quotations for, the shares of the common stock at any time after the initial issuance of such convertible securities, or (B)&nbsp;with a conversion, exercise or exchange price that is subject to being reset at some future date after the initial issuance of such convertible securities or upon the occurrence of specified or contingent events directly or indirectly related to our business; or (ii)&nbsp;enter into any agreement (including, without limitation, an equity line of credit) whereby we may sell securities at a future determined price.&#160; Also, except under certain permitted circumstances: (i)&nbsp;until the later of the date that is six months from the closing or 30 days following the date on which less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock remains outstanding, we will not issue, or enter into any agreement to issue, any shares of common stock or equivalents thereof; (ii)&nbsp;until the time that less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants remain outstanding, we may not issue, nor enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the exercise price of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants; (iii)&nbsp;until the time that less than 7.5% of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock remains outstanding, we may not issue, nor enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock unless all shares of common stock underlying the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock (taking into consideration the effect of the full adjustment of the anti-dilution provisions from such dilutive issuance) are permitted by certain SEC rules&nbsp;to be issued under the registration statement; (iv)&nbsp;if we issue securities within the six months following the Series&nbsp;E Closing Date under the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement, and subject to the preexisting rights of other security holders, the Series&nbsp;E Investors shall have the right of first refusal to purchase all of the securities on the same terms, conditions and price provided for in the proposed
</FONT>
</FONT>
	issuance of securities; and (v)&nbsp;we will indemnify the Series&nbsp;E Investors against certain losses resulting from our breach of any of our representations, warranties, or covenants under agreements with the Series&nbsp;E Investors, as well as under certain other circumstances described in the Series&nbsp;E Purchase Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	21
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_21_125406_7748">
</A>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage72"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:21.75PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Series&nbsp;E Investors agreed to be subject to a blocker that would prevent each of their respective common stock ownership at any given time from exceeding 4.99% (which may be increased, but not above 9.99%) of our outstanding common stock.&#160; We agreed to seek stockholder approval at a special stockholders&#146; meeting held on April&nbsp;28, 2015 for the terms of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and the issuance and delivery in the aggregate of that number of shares of common stock exceeding 19.99% of the outstanding shares of common stock upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and exercise of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants.&#160; As discussed above, the terms of the Series&nbsp;E Financing were approved by our stockholders at the April&nbsp;28, 2015 special meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:21.75PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Series&nbsp;E Financing was effected as a takedown off our shelf registration statement on Form&nbsp;S-3, which became effective on October&nbsp;2, 2014, pursuant to a prospectus supplement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on February&nbsp;13, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	See below for modifications made to the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock and the Series&nbsp;E Warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Private Placement Warrant Financing
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Substantially concurrently with the closing of the Series&nbsp;E Financing, on February&nbsp;13, 2015, we entered into a separate securities purchase agreement (the &#147;Warrant Purchase Agreement&#148;) with selected accredited institutional pre-existing investors (the &#147;Private Placement Investors&#148;), pursuant to which we agreed to sell to the Private Placement Investors warrants to purchase 102,678 shares of Common Stock (the &#147;Private Placement Warrants&#148;, and the transactions contemplated by the Warrant Purchase Agreement, the &#147;Warrant Financing&#148;).&#160; In consideration of an aggregate of $1,000, we had agreed to sell the Private Placement Warrants, which would not be issued unless and until our stockholders approved amending our Certificate of Incorporation to increase our authorized common stock to permit the issuance of the common
</FONT>
	stock issuable upon exercise of the Private Placement Warrants (the &#147;Charter Amendment&#148;).&#160; We estimated the fair value of the Private Placement Warrants using the Black-Scholes valuation model to be $1.82 million, which was classified as a warrant subscription payable within additional paid-in capital in our consolidated balance sheet using the following assumptions:&#160; (i)&nbsp;closing stock price and Private Placement Warrants contractual exercise price; (ii)&nbsp;5.5 year term; (iii)&nbsp;historical volatilities commensurate with the term of the Private Placement Warrants of 113.2%; and (iv)&nbsp;risk-free interest rates commensurate with the term of the Private Placement Warrants of 1.5%.&#160; We allocated the proceeds received from the Series&nbsp;E Financing to the Private Placement Warrants based on the relative fair value of the instruments issued to the Series&nbsp;E Investors.
</FONT>
	&#160; As a result of the special stockholders meeting held on April&nbsp;28 2015 discussed above, we issued the Private Placement Warrants to the Private Placement Investors and the warrant subscription payable was reclassified to additional paid-in capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Each Private Placement Warrant initially had an exercise price of $32.505 per share of common stock (subject to adjustment for stock splits and the like), which was 110% of the consolidated closing bid price of our common stock on Nasdaq immediately prior to entering into the Warrant Purchase Agreement, and is exercisable at any time after the six month anniversary of entering into the Warrant Purchase Agreement and on or prior to the close of business on the five year anniversary of the initial exercise date, subject to the beneficial ownership limitation described below.&#160; The Private Placement Warrants are not subject to price based anti-dilution protection.&#160; If, at the time of exercise of a Private Placement Warrant, there is no effective registration statement registering for resale the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Private Placement Warrant, the holder may exercise the Private Placement Warrant on a cashless basis.&#160; When exercised on a cashless basis, a portion of the Private Placement Warrant is cancelled in payment of the purchase price payable in respect of the number of shares of common stock purchasable upon such exercise.&#160; Subject to the beneficial ownership limitation described below, if, after the one year anniversary of the date of entering into the Warrant Purchase Agreement, the volume weighted average price of our common stock on Nasdaq exceeds 200% of the Private Placement Warrant exercise price for ten consecutive trading days, then we may, within one trading day thereafter, call for cancellation of up to 50% of the Private Placement Warrants for consideration equal to $0.001 per share of common stock underlying the Private Placement Warrants.&#160; We may not exercise our call rights if, among other things, there is no effective registration statement registering for resale the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the Private Placement Warrants.&#160; Subject to limited exceptions, a holder of Private Placement Warrants will not have the right to exercise any portion of its Private Placement Warrants if the holder, together with its affiliates, would beneficially own in excess of 4.99% (which may be increased, but not above 9.99%) of the number of shares of our common stock outstanding immediately after giving effect to such exercise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	22
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_22_125442_141">
</A>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For as long as the Private Placement Investors hold any Private Placement Warrants, we will not enter into an agreement to affect a &#147;Variable Rate Transaction,&#148; with similar terms and prohibitions described above.&#160; We also agreed that, except under
</FONT>
</FONT>
	certain permitted circumstances until the time that less than 7.5% of the Private Placement Warrants remain outstanding, we will not issue, nor enter into any agreement to issue, common stock or equivalents thereof at a price below the exercise price of the Private Placement Warrants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	See below for modifications made to the Private Placement Warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Modification of Certain Other Outstanding Warrants
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In connection with the purchase of the Private Placement Warrants, we modified previously issued and outstanding warrants held by the Private Placement Investors that were issued in connection with the Series&nbsp;A, Series&nbsp;B and Series&nbsp;C financings described above, to (i)&nbsp;reduce the exercise prices thereunder to $29.55, which represents the consolidated closing bid price of our common stock on Nasdaq immediately prior to the date we entered into the Warrant Purchase Agreement; (ii)&nbsp;prohibit the exercise of such modified warrants for a period of six months after the date of the modification; and (iii)&nbsp;extend the exercise period of such modified warrants for an additional six months (such modifications, collectively, the &#147;Warrant Price Modifications&#148;).&#160; Separately, we also agreed to a Warrant Price Modification with a holder of Series&nbsp;C Warrants solely in consideration for such holder&#146;s waiver of certain preemptive rights.&#160; We estimated the change in fair value of these warrants immediately prior to and immediately subsequent to the Warrant Price Modification to be $336,000, and such amount has been recorded as a non-cash equity offering cost.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series&nbsp;E Modifications
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On October&nbsp;12, 2015, we entered into an Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Common Stock Purchase Warrants (the &#147;Warrants Amendment&#148;) with each of the holders of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants and each of the holders of the Private Placement Warrants.&#160; Under the terms of the Warrants Amendment, all of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants and 100,847 of the Private Placement Warrants had their exercise prices reduced to $16.50 per share.&#160; Accordingly, with respect to the Private Placement Warrants, 100,847 of the Private Placement Warrants have an exercise price of $16.50 per share and 1,831 of the Private Placement Warrants retain their original exercise price of $32.505 per share.&#160; In consideration for entering into the Warrants Amendment, each Series&nbsp;E Investor agreed to irrevocably waive
<I>
	ab initio
</I>
	and for all time its right to receive cash dividends on its shares of our Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock.&#160; As a result, no dividends relating to the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock were recognized in our consolidated financial statements for 2015, nor do we expect to recognize any Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock dividends in the future from executing the Warrants Amendment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We estimated the change in fair value of the Series&nbsp;E Warrants and the affected Private Placement Warrants prior to and immediately subsequent to the Warrants Amendment to be $168,000, which was recognized as a deemed dividend and as an increase to additional paid-in capital during the fourth quarter of 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A16-4734_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	12.
</FONT>
</B>
	&#160;
<B>
	EQUITY-BASED COMPENSATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our employees participate in the CombiMatrix Corporation 2006 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;CombiMatrix Plan&#148;), which was approved by our board of directors in 2006.&#160; In addition, during 2005, the board of directors of our wholly owned subsidiary, CombiMatrix Molecular Diagnostics,&nbsp;Inc., approved the CombiMatrix Molecular Diagnostics 2005 Stock Award Plan (the &#147;CMDX Plan&#148;).&#160; Our board of directors believes that granting employees stock-based awards from the CombiMatrix Plan is in the best interest of our Company and our stockholders.&#160; No awards have been granted to the CMDX Plan since 2010, and it is no longer being utilized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	CombiMatrix Corporation 2006 Stock Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The CombiMatrix Plan is administered by the Compensation Committee (the &#147;Committee&#148;) of our Board of Directors.&#160; The Committee determines which eligible individuals are to receive option grants or stock issuances under the CombiMatrix Plan, the time or times when the grants or issuances are to be made, the number of shares subject to each grant or issuance, the status of any granted option as either an incentive stock option or a non-statutory stock option under the federal tax laws, the vesting schedule to be in effect for the option grant or stock issuance and the maximum term for which any granted option is to remain outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The CombiMatrix Plan is divided into two separate equity incentive programs:&#160; a discretionary option grant / stock appreciation right program and a stock issuance program.&#160; To date, the discretionary option grant program has been the primary program used in awarding stock-based compensation.&#160; Under the discretionary option grant program, the Committee may grant non-statutory options to purchase shares of CombiMatrix stock to eligible individuals in our employ (including employees, non-employee board members and consultants) at an exercise price not less than 100% of the fair market value of those shares on the grant date, and incentive stock options to purchase shares of CombiMatrix stock to eligible employees at an exercise price not less than 100% of the fair market value of those shares on the grant date.&#160; Options are generally exercisable over a three- or four-year vesting term following the date of grant and expire ten years after the grant date.&#160; The Committee may grant other forms of equity based compensation, such as restricted stock units (&#147;RSU&#146;s&#148;), which the Committee awarded to certain executives and directors of the Company for the first time during 2014.&#160; RSUs vest in equal annual installments over a four-year period following the date of grant.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were 194,039 authorized shares under the CombiMatrix Plan, with 85,249 shares available for grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following is a summary of the stock option activities under the CombiMatrix Plan for 2015 and 2014:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The aggregate fair value of options vested during the years ended
</FONT>
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was $321,000 and $359,000, respectively
</FONT>
	.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the total unrecognized compensation expense related to non-vested stock option awards was $1.2 million, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted average term of approximately 2.5 years.

	The following is a summary of the RSU activities under the CombiMatrix Plan for 2015 and 2014:

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="71%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:71.84%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.4%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

	Our wholly owned subsidiary, CMDX, executed the CMDX Plan, with plan provisions and terms similar to that of the CombiMatrix Plan as described above.&#160; At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were 4.0 million authorized shares available under the CMDX Plan, with approximately 3.8 million shares available for grant.&#160; However, our Board of Directors has no intention of utilizing this plan in the future.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	There were no option grants during 2015 or 2014 under the CMDX Plan.&#160; The fair value of options vested during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 was not significant.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the total unrecognized compensation expense related to non-vested stock option awards was not significant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock Option Awards Granted to Non-Employees
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Stock option expense reflected in the consolidated statements of operations related to stock options issued to our non-employee scientific advisory board members and consultants are recognized at fair value using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with weighted average assumptions as disclosed in Note 2 under &#147;Stock-Based Compensation.&#148; For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, non-cash charges recognized from stock option awards granted to non-employees was not significant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	13.
</FONT>
</B>
	&#160;
<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On February&nbsp;4, 2016, we entered into a Series&nbsp;E 6% Convertible Preferred Stock Repurchase Agreement (the &#147;Repurchase Agreement&#148;) with the Series&nbsp;E Investors of its outstanding Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock.&#160; Pursuant to the terms of the Repurchase Agreement, the we agreed to pay each Series&nbsp;E Investor $300 per share of Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock, or approximately $656,000, in consideration for the right to repurchase such Series&nbsp;E Investor&#146;s Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock at a price per share of $1,000 (the &#147;Repurchase Price&#148;), which was the original price per share paid by the Series&nbsp;E Investors for their Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock in February&nbsp;2015.&#160; We must repurchase the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock within one business day after closing of a public offering.&#160; In connection with entering into the Repurchase Agreement, we were granted certain consents and waivers relating to a public offering.&#160; In the event that a public offering is not consummated by the date set forth in the Repurchase Agreement, the Repurchase Agreement will terminate and we will not be obligated to repurchase the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock.&#160; By entering into the Repurchase Agreement, we have averted the potentially significant dilution that would have occurred from the full ratchet of the conversion price of the Series&nbsp;E Preferred Stock upon closing of a public offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:17.4PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
	26
<A NAME="A16-4734_110K_HTM_PB_26_131449_7748">
</A>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:10.0%;">

	32.1
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.0%;">

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exhibit 10.4
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMBIMATRIX CORPORATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2006 STOCK INCENTIVE PLAN
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(as amended and restated June&nbsp;17, 2015)(1)
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ARTICLE&nbsp;ONE
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	GENERAL PROVISIONS
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	I.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	PURPOSE OF THE PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This CombiMatrix Corporation 2006 Stock Incentive Plan is intended to promote the interests of CombiMatrix Corporation, a Delaware corporation, by providing eligible persons in the Corporation&#146;s Service with the opportunity to acquire a proprietary interest, or otherwise increase their proprietary interest, in the Corporation as an incentive for them to remain in such Service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Capitalized terms shall have the meanings assigned to such terms in the attached Appendix.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	II.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	STRUCTURE OF THE PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	A.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Plan shall be divided into three separate equity incentive programs:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Discretionary Option/Stock Appreciation Right Grant Program under which eligible persons may, at the discretion of the Plan Administrator, be granted options to purchase shares of Common Stock, and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:1.0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="SYMBOL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#183;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	the Stock Issuance Program under which eligible persons may, at the discretion of the Plan Administrator, be issued shares of Common Stock directly, either through the immediate purchase of such shares or as a bonus for services rendered the Corporation (or any Parent or Subsidiary).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	B.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The provisions of Articles One and Five shall apply to all equity incentive programs under the Plan and shall govern the interests of all persons under the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	III.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<B>
	ADMINISTRATION OF THE PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	A.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The Committee shall have sole and exclusive authority to administer the Discretionary Option Grant and Stock Issuance Programs with respect to Section&nbsp;16 Insiders. Administration of the Discretionary Option Grant and Stock Issuance Programs with respect to
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="1" WIDTH="25%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:BLACK;">
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)&nbsp; All share numbers reflect the fifteen-for-one reverse stock split of the Corporation&#146;s Common Stock effected at the close of business on January&nbsp;29, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
	1
<A NAME="A16-4734_1EX10D4_HTM_PB_1_131322_7056">
</A>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
